Each year, during the week that includes September 17, Texas schools honor Celebrate Freedom Week to highlight the values and ideals on which the United States was founded as well as the sacrifices that were made for freedom in the founding of the country. To learn more about the U.S. Constitution, visit https://www.senate.gov/civics/constitution_item/constitution.htm. #CelebrateFreedomWeek #ConstitutionDay

The training is scheduled to begin around 8 am and continue through the morning. There will be an increased number of police and emergency vehicles in the area.

Classes and activities will continue as scheduled at all schools across the district. We are grateful for the partnership with the Fort Worth Police Department and their efforts to keep their officers up-to-date with procedural training to serve our schools and community.

District leaders immediately began reviewing the guidance and are working to incorporate these recommendations into our Safe Return to Schools Plan for 2020-2021. Additional details about enhanced safety measures for in-person learning, as well as plans for remote learning, will be shared with families and staff on Thursday, July 16. The full Safe Return to Schools Guide for Families will be available on the district website in the coming weeks. We appreciate your partnership as we continue to work through unprecedented challenges and ongoing uncertainties to provide safe and strong learning options for our community. #EveryMemberSafe

Please visit https://www.emsisd.com/return20202021 for more information on the Return to School 2020-2021.

EMS ISD and the Board of Trustees are hosting a ceremony to dedicate the football field at Rough Rider Stadium in honor of retired teacher, coach, and principal, Ric Canterbury on Wednesday, October 16, at 5 pm.

Canterbury served the Saginaw and EMS ISD communities for 23 years. He was hired as a teacher and coach in 1996 and then served in several campus leadership roles before being selected to open Saginaw High School in 2005 as its first principal. Canterbury served as SHS principal until his retirement in 2012 but continued serving as a teacher and coach until his second retirement in May 2019. Known fondly as "Rough Rider Ric," Canterbury made it a point to get to know as many students and their families as he could. He understood the importance of building positive, encouraging relationships with students and his legacy lives on within the strong culture and spirit of Saginaw High School and the EMS community. We are #emsproud to honor his legacy with this naming dedication.
